assignment5hangman

Class DrawMan

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment5hangman.DrawMan

  • public class DrawMan
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the DrawMan class of the Hangman program. It stores the current state of the drawn man (between 0 and 8), provides a getter to return that state to the Word class, and has a draw method where the man is drawn step by step based on wrong letter guesses from the user. I, Sean Flannigan, student number 000270501, certify that all code submitted is my own work; that I have not copied it from any other source. I also certify that I have not allowed my work to be copied by others.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DrawMan(int manState)
      Constructor for the DrawMan class, accepts an int param that will contain a 0, in order to reset the state of the drawing back to 0.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int checkState()
      checkState method called from the Word class in order to check how far along the drawing of the man is and decide if the game is over as a loss.
      void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      draw method, which is the third of three methods of its type, used to pass along the GraphicsContext param from the view to this final destination in the DrawMan class.
      void wrongGuess()
      wrongGuess method called from within the charEntry method inside the Word class, increments the state of the drawing of the man by 1 due to a wrong letter guess from the user.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawMan

        public DrawMan(int manState)
        Constructor for the DrawMan class, accepts an int param that will contain a 0, in order to reset the state of the drawing back to 0.
        Parameters:
        manState - int variable containing a 0, to reset the state of the drawn man

    • Method Detail

      • wrongGuess

        public void wrongGuess()
        wrongGuess method called from within the charEntry method inside the Word class, increments the state of the drawing of the man by 1 due to a wrong letter guess from the user.

      • checkState

        public int checkState()
        checkState method called from the Word class in order to check how far along the drawing of the man is and decide if the game is over as a loss. User loses when the manState variable reaches 8.
        Returns:
        manState int variable containing a number from 0-8, representing the current state of the drawing of the man

      • draw

        public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        draw method, which is the third of three methods of its type, used to pass along the GraphicsContext param from the view to this final destination in the DrawMan class. Once called, a switch structure checks the manState int variable and will draw the next part of the man based on what state that variable is currently up to.
        Parameters:
        gc - Graphics context originally from the view
